DA4BCI 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Kernel Mean Matching Weights

    kmm_weights.Rd

    kmm_weights computes KMM reweighting coefficients for covariate shift by solving a box-constrained QP via quadprog::solve.QP.

    kmm_weights(Xs, Xt, sigma = NULL, B = 100, eps = NULL)

    Arguments

    Xs

    Numeric matrix (n × d): source samples.

    Xt

    Numeric matrix (m × d): target samples.

    sigma

    Optional positive bandwidth; defaults to sigma_med(Xs, Xt).

    B

    Positive upper bound for each weight.

    eps

    Nonnegative tolerance on total weight; default B / sqrt(n).

    Value

    Numeric vector (length n) with weights in \([0, B]\).

    Details

    With RBF kernels Kss and Kst from rbf_kernel, minimize \(\tfrac{1}{2} w^\top K_{ss} w - \kappa^\top w\) subject to \(0 \le w_i \le B\) and \(|1^\top w - n| \le \varepsilon\), where \(\kappa=(n/m)K_{st}\mathbf{1}\). A small ridge is added to ensure PD.

    See also

    sigma_med, distanceSummary

    Other domain-adaptation: distanceSummary(), euclidean_alignment(), evaluate_shift(), label_shift_em(), proxy_a_distance()

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
set.seed(1)
Xs <- matrix(rnorm(200), 20, 10); Xt <- matrix(rnorm(150, 1), 15, 10)
w <- kmm_weights(Xs, Xt, B = 10); range(w)
} # }
